definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: A:Operator?I want to make a call back to China.
sentences.chinese: 接线生吗？我想打电话回中国。

sentences.english: Operator, I'd like to call Taibei, please. Station-to-station.
sentences.chinese: 接线生，我要打到台北的叫号电话。

sentences.english: I'm afraid all calls to guest room must go through the operator.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，所有打到客房的电话都要通过我们接线生转。

sentences.english: Years ago an operator had to make the connection.
sentences.chinese: 多年前必须有接线生来做接通的耕作。

sentences.english: Yes, operator. I'm trying to call New-York.
sentences.chinese: 是，接线生，我要打到纽约。

sentences.english: The operator told me to hang up and dial the same number again.
sentences.chinese: 接线生叫我挂断电话再拨同一号码。

sentences.english: Operator, do I have to wait a long time?
sentences.chinese: 接线生，我需要等很久吗？

sentences.english: On all these vessels there is a radio officer handling messages.
sentences.chinese: 所有的船上都有一个无线电接线生负责收发讯息。

sentences.english: I'd like to talk to Director Chen.
sentences.chinese: 接线生，我想与陈主任谈话。

definition: to notify sb of a call/to call sb to the phone
police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
